intro: Hieracium vulgatum subsp. incurrens, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The plant features yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, with ray florets that are usually shorter than the central disk florets. Its leaves are alternate, rough to the touch, and often have a hairy texture. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, commonly known as the daisy or sunflower family.
